Hmm, seems like `testBrokerTopicMetricsUnregisteredAfterDeletingTopic` fails transiently now:

https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/kafka-trunk/1937/testReport/junit/kafka.metrics/MetricsTest/testBrokerTopicMetricsUnregisteredAfterDeletingTopic/
PR that makes assertion more informative: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3042
By the way, this issue also affects trunk. I don't remember what the process is for PR submission - is a separate PR against trunk needed?

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.11/3866/
Test FAILed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).
Thanks for the PR. Yes, we generally submit PRs for trunk and cherry-pick if it applies cleanly. Otherwise, separate PRs are needed.

Thanks for looking into this !
I've managed to reproduce the failure. The metrics are being re-created by `ReplicaManager` after the topic has been deleted:
```
...
creating kafka.producer:type=ProducerTopicMetrics,name=MessagesPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.producer:type=ProducerTopicMetrics,name=BytesPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.producer:type=ProducerTopicMetrics,name=DroppedMessagesPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=BytesRejectedPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=FailedProduceRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=FailedFetchRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=TotalProduceRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=TotalFetchRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
...
Entering topicMetricGroups
Exiting topicMetricGroups with Set(kafka.server.BrokerTopicMetrics.topic.test-broker-topic-metric)
Calling AdminUtils.deleteTopic
Calling TestUtils.verifyTopicDeletion
...
Entering in KafkaRequestHandler.close
Tags: Map(topic -> test-broker-topic-metric)
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=MessagesInPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=BytesInPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=BytesOutPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=BytesRejectedPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=ReplicationBytesInPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=ReplicationBytesOutPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=FailedProduceRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=FailedFetchRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=TotalProduceRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
removing kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=TotalFetchRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
Exiting KafkaRequestHandler.close
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=MessagesInPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
java.lang.Error
	at kafka.metrics.KafkaMetricsGroup$class.newMeter(KafkaMetricsGroup.scala:86)
	at kafka.server.BrokerTopicMetrics.newMeter(KafkaRequestHandler.scala:108)
	at kafka.server.BrokerTopicMetrics.<init>(KafkaRequestHandler.scala:114)
	at kafka.server.BrokerTopicStats$$anonfun$2.apply(KafkaRequestHandler.scala:158)
	at kafka.server.BrokerTopicStats$$anonfun$2.apply(KafkaRequestHandler.scala:158)
	at kafka.utils.Pool$$anonfun$getAndMaybePut$1.apply(Pool.scala:52)
	at kafka.utils.Pool.getAndMaybePut(Pool.scala:70)
	at kafka.utils.Pool.getAndMaybePut(Pool.scala:52)
	at kafka.server.BrokerTopicStats$.getBrokerTopicStats(KafkaRequestHandler.scala:165)
	at kafka.server.ReplicaManager.kafka$server$ReplicaManager$$read$1(ReplicaManager.scala:651)
	at kafka.server.ReplicaManager$$anonfun$readFromLocalLog$1.apply(ReplicaManager.scala:746)
	at kafka.server.ReplicaManager$$anonfun$readFromLocalLog$1.apply(ReplicaManager.scala:745)
	at scala.collection.mutable.ResizableArray$class.foreach(ResizableArray.scala:59)
	at scala.collection.mutable.ArrayBuffer.foreach(ArrayBuffer.scala:48)
	at kafka.server.ReplicaManager.readFromLocalLog(ReplicaManager.scala:745)
	at kafka.server.DelayedFetch.onComplete(DelayedFetch.scala:148)
	at kafka.server.DelayedOperation.forceComplete(DelayedOperation.scala:66)
	at kafka.server.DelayedOperation.run(DelayedOperation.scala:112)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=BytesInPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=BytesOutPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=BytesRejectedPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=FailedProduceRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=FailedFetchRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=TotalProduceRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=TotalFetchRequestsPerSec,topic=test-broker-topic-metric
creating kafka.server:type=DelayedFetchMetrics,name=ExpiresPerSec,fetcherType=follower
creating kafka.server:type=DelayedFetchMetrics,name=ExpiresPerSec,fetcherType=consumer
Entering topicMetricGroups
Exiting topicMetricGroups with Set(kafka.server.BrokerTopicMetrics.topic.test-broker-topic-metric)

```
Also if I replace the call to the deprecated `createAndShutdownStep` by `TestUtils.produceMessages`, I'm not able to hit the failure
edit: I was wrong regex checks out so I removed my comment

Thanks @mimaison. Looks like a fetch request causes the metrics to be recreated. Your suggestion to use the new producer/consumer is a good one so I made that change. I also added some additional checks to the other flaky test in that class: `testBrokerTopicMetricsBytesInOut` (suggested by @junrao).

Thanks for the PR, @ewencp. This only affects what is displayed in the RST and HTML output for Class defaults, right? It seems reasonable for the output to match what people can use themselves, so just asking to make sure I understood what is being fixed.
Failure is unrelated (fixed by https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3042), will run the PR builder again just to be sure.

@ijuma, thanks for reviewing. I have updated this PR to take into account your review comments. I updated those existing test methods to include checks for the `-delete` variant, instead of creating separate test methods for each of those existing ones. However, I am open to create new test methods for them, if you think that's a better idea.

@ijuma It also affects Connect's REST API since it depends on this conversion to strings as well.

https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/3884/

Another example is that it affects recommended config values during validation. This can happen even in standalone mode during config validation. Transformations present a case where nested classes are used, and therefore what's the actual recommended string matters.
Looks LGTM to me.

The test failure on JDK 7 is happening on other PR's too.
Test failure is not related to this change.
